title: restoring lost address book and emails in Thunderbird
content: Hi: I recently set up a new computer. I copied over all the important files I could find before a full hard-drive erase of my old computer. I reloaded Mozilla Thunderbird linked to my Earthlink account. However, upon opening Thunderbird, I discovered that my address book and all saved emails in Thunderbird were lost, and I didn't save them in the Earthlink account itself other than the address book. I do daily backups with Carbonite. Is there a file or files I can look for in my Carbonite backup files that would contain the saved emails? If so, what are their names?
creator: jodywidelitz

title: Problemi invio posta da più account
content:
Buongiorno, da alcune settimane ho il seguente problema. Ho configurato nel browser diversi account, ogni volta che cambio account per inviare una mail mi compare il pop-up che mi dice: "si è verificato un errore nell'invio della posta. Il server di posta ha risposto MAIL FROM < xxx.yyy@fastwebnet.it> does not match authenticaded user name. Verificare l'indirizzo email nelle impostazione dell'account e riprovare." Ogni volta che devo usare un accaount diverso da quello usato per l'ultimo invio devo andare nelle impostazioni account, accedere alla modifica server SMPT e cambiare il campo nome utente perchè qui viene riscritto quello dell'utente dell'ultimo invio. Sembra che questo problema si presenti solo con gli indirizzi di Fastweb perchè gli account di Gmail sembrano funzionare correttamente. Grazie per il vostro supporto.

Massimo
creator: massimo.matteotti

title: errore nel nuovo account
content: Buongiorno, ho creato un nuovo account in Thundebird come al solito (ne ho già altri 11 perfettamente funzionanti), ma ogni volta che provo ad inviare una email mi riporta questo errore:"Non c’è spazio sufficiente per scaricare nuovi messaggi. Eliminare la vecchia posta, svuotare il Cestino, compattare le cartelle e riprovare." ma naturalmente il cestino è vuoto e spazio su hard disk ne ho tanto. Poi, dopo aver schiacciato "OK", mi viene fuori quest'altro messaggio:"Il messaggio è stato inviato, ma non è stata salvata una copia nella cartella inviati (Posta inviata) a causa di un errore di rete o di accesso al file. È possibile riprovare o salvare localmente il messaggio su Cartelle locali/Posta inviata-info@einwegtischdecken.com." Come posso evitare di far comparire questo errore tutte le volte? Se vi può aiutare, ho notato che l'icona della cartella "Posta inviata" di questo account che non funziona correttamente è diversa da tutte le altre icone della posta inviata degli altri account, infatti è una cartella gialla e non una freccia verde. Grazie mille
creator: uomocontratto

title: Filter Message Body With URL

I've been trying to get Thunderbird (102.6.0) to filter messages based on message body contents that contain specific URLs (such as "https://docsend.com"), but it's not working. I even tried setting emails to be viewed in plain text (as opposed to HTML), but that also didn't work.

How can I achieve this?
creator: jsimmonstx

title: Best method to achive/backup IMAP email accounts before domain/hosting is cancelled?
content:
Hi,

I have six IMAP email accounts that will cease to exist in a few weeks when I don't renew the domain/hosting where they reside.

Most of these accounts include invoices for purchases, and serial numbers etc that I need to have access to after the accounts will die, so just being able to read them offline. Even down the track when I inevitably build a new PC, I'll still want to have access to theses messages offline.

What is best practice for archiving or backing up these so I can still read them in future? Is there a way to archive so that I can read them in other clients in future? or I can only archive in a way that will be Thunderbird only?

Also... how do I get Thunderbird to allow me to read the messages from these accounts, without checking for new messages on these accounts, which would give error popups every time?

I've never had to do this before, and when I've searched around the results seem super confusing.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

In case its relevant, my current Thunderbird version is 115.12.1 and running latest update of Win 10.
creator: BradMakesNoises

title: Carpeta Enviados duplicada en Thunderbird
content: Los correos que mando desde gmail se me alojan en thunderbird en una carpeta "enviados" duplicada, y con el mismo nombre que la carpeta "enviados" original que aloja los correos que mando a través de thunderbird . Desearía unificar ambas carpetas y que tanto lo que mando via web, como usando thunderbird, fuese a la misma carpeta. Adjunto la ventana de propiedades de cada carpeta enviados que tengo en mi thunderbird

title: Doubling messages
content: Regularly the messages in some subfolders are doubled. I don't know why or how it was triggered. It is very annoying, because some subfolders contain a lot of messages. Since I don't know how to get rid of this double messages, except by deleting them by hand one at the time, it is a very time consuming matter. I tried repairing the folder, but that didn't work. I already have had a folder where all messages were doubled several times. So every message was there six, seven, or eight times! Is there somebody with an explanation and - preferably - a solution to prevent this?

title: Set Up Existing Email Address- Zoho
content:
Our small business has a handful of Zoho email addresses that we use via Thunderbird on MacOS computers in our office. The computer I am using only has some of the email addresses listed in Thunderbird, and I am trying to add the rest.

Once all requested data is entered in the "Set Up Your Existing Mail Address" screen, we receive the error message: "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, user name, or password." All of the data is correct, and I have tried this process different weeks to see if the issue will clear on its own, but no. I've attached a screenshot of the error message.

I have tried this with several pre-existing email addresses and it's giving me the same message, although it did allow me to add one address recently. That newly added, previously existing address is now somewhat accessible via Thunderbird, but every time we open Thunderbird it says "Login to server imap.zoho.com with username shipping@jadeandpearl.com failed." I can access the inbox and other folders of this account in the Thunderbird desktop app, but it is not currently showing new email.

Thunderbird version: 115.12.1 (64bit) MacOS: Sonoma 14.5
creator: JadeandPearl
